newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea to raise KEF's capital by 50 pct in Oct.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea to raise KEF's capital by 50 pct in Oct.

text.p: South Korea's finance ministry said on Friday it would increase the Korea Europe Fund's paid-in capital by 50 percent to $240 million in October.
The move was aimed at attracting foreign funds into the sagging Seoul stock market, a ministry official said.
The ministry said the limit for individual foreign investors in South Korea's country funds would also be expanded beginning from October.

The limit for the nation's three state-run country funds would be raised to seven percent from October from the current five percent for the Korea Fund and four percent each for the Korea Europe Fund and Korea Asia Fund.
Paid-in capital of the Korea Fund is valued at $380 million, while that of the Korea Asia Fund is at $200 million.
